sentence.Network_en: Generally his ideas were expressed in sententious phrase, spoken in low voice .

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin sententiosus, from sententia 'opinion' (see sentence). The original sense was 'full of meaning or wisdom', later becoming depreciatory

means.word_mean: 1. abounding in or given to pompous or aphoristic moralizing;

sentences.sentence: "too often the significant episode deteriorates into sententious conversation"- Kathleen Barnes
"the peculiarly sardonic and sententious style in which Don Luis composed his epigrams"- Hervey Allen
